body_html:
Hmm that ran correctly
Yes it is Ubuntu 16.04
Well as is my habit I made a typo on copying your code and so I pasted it all in
The docker image failed so I updated my base system..
So It reinstalled Python and tensorflow.. It seems the main thing is that it is now no longer using the GPU...
Dumb of me
It still seems to be using the Anaconda Python 3.5.2 (both "python' and "python3' bring the same Anaconda up in terminal) though but Tensorflow is no longer GPU enabled?
So I guess I need to reinstall it from source? Advice??
And I'm guesssing that my error may be due to the GPU enabling?
Or perhaps this version is slightly more up to date since I built from source a week ago?
Any chance there is a prebuilt gpu version?

body:
Hmm that ran correctly
Yes it is Ubuntu 16.04
Well as is my habit I made a typo on copying your code and so I pasted it all in
The docker image failed so I updated my base system..
So It reinstalled Python and tensorflow.. It seems the main thing is that it is now no longer using the GPU...
Dumb of me
It still seems to be using the Anaconda Python 3.5.2 (both "python' and "python3' bring the same Anaconda up in terminal) though but Tensorflow is no longer GPU enabled?
So I guess I need to reinstall it from source? Advice??
And I'm guesssing that my error may be due to the GPU enabling?
Or perhaps this version is slightly more up to date since I built from source a week ago?
Any chance there is a prebuilt gpu version?
